data.text:
Gary J. Cooper

February 24, 1952

November 8, 2023

Knowing that one day we all must leave still does not make it any easier when that time comes for someone like Gary. Gary recently left us to be in peace.

His two sons, Robert and Daniel, were with him up until that time.

Those who knew Gary best know of his great sense of humor and he was able to keep this with him all the way to the end.

Although we did not have more than a few days from when learning of his final journey to when we could no longer be with him, many of his friends and family were able visit and say one last “Good Bye”. There is no question this meant a great deal of joy and comfort to him.

It should be no surprise that Gary also made a lasting impression to those who he had just met and took final care of him.

Gary is and was a caring father and a great friend.

He is already sadly missed beyond words and even though we can no longer be with him we can all imagine that wherever he is, Gary is making new friends and surely reconnection with old ones, as that is how we knew him to be.

And that is how it will be for Gary; forever in loving memory as we will always be wondering what he may be up to next.

He is survived by

Sons, Daniel M. Cooper, his wife: Kathleen Cooper, Robert C. Cooper, his wife Tori Cooper,

Grandchildren: Abigail Cooper, David J. Cooper Grace Cooper, Claire Cooper

his precious dog, Molly
